result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey James Hejdak

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant has pending matters 22CF1695, 22CF485 and 22CM312. Case as been authorized to resolve globally in Branch 09 with felony matters. Court authorized transfer of this case to Branch 09 for a global resolution. Case placed on Branch 09 calendar for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenberg is in trial in a different court. Court authorizes transfer to felony court for global resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter in Branch 17 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorize transfer to Branch 17 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.
Case adjourned to Br. 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Defense has received discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marshalls

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey James Hejdak appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/22 @ 2:30p
